name: Three-Cheese Hearty Greens and Puff Pastry Tart
description: Swiss chard, spinach, and leeks mixed with ricotta, Gruyère, Parmesan, and pine nuts makes the perfect filling for a slightly virtuous, slightly decadent vegetarian puff pastry tart.
recipeIngredient: 2 medium leeks, white and green parts only, chopped (about 3 1/2 ounces chopped leeks)
28 ounces curly spinach, stemmed and roughly chopped
14 ounces (about 1 large bunch) Swiss chard, tough stalks removed, leaves roughly chopped
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the leeks. Cook, stirring frequently, until soft and translucent but not browned, about 5 minutes. Add the spinach and chard, and raise the heat to high. Sauté until all the greens are completely wilted and all the liquid has evaporated. Transfer to a bowl to cool.

Once the greens have cooled slightly, add the ricotta, Gruyère, parmesan, and pine nuts, and stir to completely combine. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Roll out the pastry on a parchment-lined sheet tray to a 12-inch circle. Spread the spinach mixture on top. Bake until the pastry is golden and crisp, 15 to 20 minutes. Cut into slices and serve.
